ControlledConcept.gml:description: constituent occurs as a collection of particles that are characterized by average properties of the individual particles Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:particulate_constituent
ControlledConcept.name: Particulate constituent

ControlledConcept.gml:description: any crystal in an igneous or metamorphic rock that is sgnificantly larger than the surounding groundmass. May be a phenocryst, xenocryst, porphyroblast or porphyroclast Source: Neuendorf et al 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:megacryst
ControlledConcept.name: Megacryst

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent occurs as crystals formed by metamorphic crystallization, set in a finer-grained groundmass. Source: Fettes and Desmons, 2007
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:porphyroblast
ControlledConcept.name: Porphyroblast

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent occurs as crystals that are distinctly larger than a groundmass of enclosing crystals. Used only in igneous rocks. Source: Neuendorf et al. 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:phenocryst
ControlledConcept.name: Phenocryst

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Relict crystal in metamorphic rock, in groundmass of relatively finer-grained material. Connotes that groundmass is result of tectonic reduction in grain size. Source: Spry, 1969
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:porphyroclast
ControlledConcept.name: Porphyroclast

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent forms an interconnected network of discernible crystals. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:crystalline_framework_constituent
ControlledConcept.name: Crystalline framework constituent

ControlledConcept.gml:description: "Constituent forms a rigid arrangement of particles that support one another at their points of contact...constituting a mechanically firm structure capable of supporting open pore spaces, although interstices may be occupied by cement or matrix" Source: Jackson, 1997, p. 250
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:granular_framework_constituent
ControlledConcept.name: Granular framework constituent

ControlledConcept.gml:description: a crystal of an earlier rock that is prevented from further reaction in a later rock by a rim of reaction products Source: base on Neuendorf et al 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:armoured_relict_crystal
ControlledConcept.name: Armoured relict crystal

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent occurs as crystals that poikilitically enclose crystals of other phases in an igneous rock. Source: Neuendorf et al., 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:oikocryst
ControlledConcept.name: Oikocryst

ControlledConcept.gml:description: the enclosed crystal in a poikolitic texture Source: Neuendorf et al., 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:chadacryst
ControlledConcept.name: Chadacryst

ControlledConcept.gml:description: a relatively large and conspicuous fragment in a sediment or sedimentary rock Source: Neuendorf et al., 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:phenoclast
ControlledConcept.name: Phenoclast

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent is distributed through the material between other constituent particles Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:interstitial_constituent
ControlledConcept.name: Interstitial constituent

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent forms an interconnected network of material enclosing other constituents that are disguished by larger grain size. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:groundmass_constituent
ControlledConcept.name: Groundmass constituent

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent forms finer-grained material interstitial to a framework constituent. "The finer-grained material enclosing, or filling the interstices between, the larger grains or particles of a sediment or sedimentary rock....The term refers to the relative size and disposition of the particles, and no particular particle size is implied" (Jackson, 1997, p. 393). May be classifiable into orthomatrix, protomatrix, epimatrix, pseudomatrix, and unclassified matrix. Source: NADM SLTTs 2004; Jackson, 1997
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:matrix
ControlledConcept.name: Matrix

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A constituent that occupies space between individual grains of a consolidated sedimentary rock, and binds the grains together as a rigid, coherent mass; it may be derived from the sediment or its entrapped waters, or it may be brought in by solution from outside sources. Material is usually chemically precipitated (Jackson, 1997, p. 103). Distinguished from matrix by clearly secondary origin and generally monomineralic character. Source: NADM SLTTs 2004; Jackson, 1997
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:sedimentary_rock_cement
ControlledConcept.name: Sedimentary rock cement

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A type of matrix consisting of inhomogeneous interstitial materials grown in originally open interstices during diagenesis, but lacking the homogeneity and clear textural evidence of pore-filling needed to classify as phyllosilicate cement. Source: NADM SLTTs 2004; Dickinson, 1970
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:epimatrix
ControlledConcept.name: Epimatrix

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A type of matrix consisting of soft deformable framework grains that are squeezed and flattened between stronger framework grains. Source: NADM SLTTs 2004; Dickinson, 1970
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:pseudomatrix
ControlledConcept.name: Pseudomatrix

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A type of matrix consisting of un-recrystallized detrital clayey lutum (clay fraction, less than 2 micron) in weakly consolidated rocks. Source: NADM SLTTs 2004; Dickinson, 1970
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:protomatrix
ControlledConcept.name: Protomatrix

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A type of matrix consisting of recrystallized detrital lutum (clay fraction, less than 2 micron) or protomatrix. Source: NADM SLTTs 2004; Dickinson, 1970
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:orthomatrix
ControlledConcept.name: Orthomatrix

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Orthomatrix in matrix supported sedimentary rock. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:clast_supporting_orthomatrix
ControlledConcept.name: Clast supporting orthomatrix

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent occurs in a structural configuration integral to the rock, such as layering, veinlets, overgrowths. The 'material' composition of these parts will often be other rock materials, not minerals, and 'ParticleGeometryDescription' associated with these describes the geometry of the constituent, not the particles the it is made of. These roles are mostly useful for RockMaterial descriptions that apply to individual samples, because their distribution is unlikely to be pervasive enought to be considered characteristic of a large mass of material. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:structural_part
ControlledConcept.name: Structural part

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent crystallized in crystallographic continuity with some other mineral constituent, typically quartz or calcite. In a clastic rock, commonly forms cement as well, but this should be represented using two role attribute links, 'overgrowth' and cement, because overgrowth does not necessarily imply cement. Source: NADM SLTTs 2004; Neuendorf et al. 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:overgrowth
ControlledConcept.name: Overgrowth

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent occurs as a concentric envelope enclosing another constituent. Corona is a non-genetic term. Source: Williams, Turner and Gilbert, 1954; Spry, 1969; Fettes and Desmons, 2007
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:corona
ControlledConcept.name: Corona

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Corona that consists of concentric bands with radial fibrous texture. Source: Williams, Turner and Gilbert, 1954; Fettes and Desmons, 2007
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:kelyphitic_rim
ControlledConcept.name: Kelyphitic rim

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A corona formed by a secondary mineral around an orginal igneous crystal, formed by modification of the crystal by the corrosive action of its parent magma Source: Neuendorf et al., 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:corrosion_rim
ControlledConcept.name: Corrosion rim

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A thin sheet compositionally distinct from the surrounding material, related to primary genesis of rock, e.g. sedimentary layers, metamorphic segregation Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:layer
ControlledConcept.name: Layer

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Thin sheet of material intruded into the rock. May be hydrothermal, magmatic, or sedimentary. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:vein
ControlledConcept.name: Vein

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A constituent with irregular distribution and geometry, as in pseudobreccia or patch migmatite. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:irregular_part
ControlledConcept.name: Irregular part

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A cluster of ferromagnesian minerals in an igneous rock, from several centimeters to decimeters in diameter, that may be a segregation or an altered xenolith. Source: Neuendorf et al, 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:clot
ControlledConcept.name: Clot

ControlledConcept.gml:description: Constituent is a clast that has no visible contacts with other clasts. Interpreted to be largely or completly immersed in matrix or cement. Source: Pettijohn et al., 1972, p. 90; SMR
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:floating_clast
ControlledConcept.name: Floating clast

ControlledConcept.gml:description: "An oversized stone in laminated sediment that depresses the underlying laminae and may be covered by -draped laminae. Most dropstones originate through ice-rafting; other sources are floating tree roots and kelp holdfasts...." Source: NADM SLTTs 2004; Jackson, 1997, p 193
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:dropstone
ControlledConcept.name: Dropstone

ControlledConcept.gml:description: A hard, compact mass or aggregate of mineral matter, normally subsperical but commonly oblate, disc-shaped or irregular. Formed by precipitation of mineral from solution in the pores of a granular rock, localized around a nucleus or center, to define a discrete, sharply separated object. Size ranges from cm to decimeter for application as a compoundMaterialConstituentPart; larger concretions should be considered GeologicUnit parts. Source: Neuendorf et al, 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:small_concretion
ControlledConcept.name: Small concretion

ControlledConcept.gml:description: a fragment of older material within an igneous rock to which it may or may not be genetically related Source: Neuendorf et al, 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:inclusion
ControlledConcept.name: Inclusion

ControlledConcept.gml:description: an inclusion of an earlier rock that is prevented from further reaction in a later rock by a rim of reaction products Source: base on Neuendorf et al 2005
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:armoured_relict_inclusion
ControlledConcept.name: Armoured relict inclusion

ControlledConcept.gml:description: For descriptions in which role of constituent in compound material is not specified. Source: this vocabulary
ControlledConcept.gml:name: urn:cgi:classifier:CGI:CompoundMaterialConstituentPartRole:200811:constituent_role_not_specified
ControlledConcept.name: Constituent role not specified
